concept.title: Reference Topic Type
concept.shortdesc: This topic provides an in-depth understanding of the Reference topic type, explaining its purpose, characteristics, and common use cases.

conbody.p: In DITA (Darwin Information Typing Architecture), a Reference topic is a vital topic type designed to provide comprehensive and detailed information about specific elements, parameters, or features. It serves the primary purpose of offering detailed reference material.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The primary purpose of a Reference topic is to present users with comprehensive and detailed information about specific elements, parameters, or features. It is intended to serve as a reference guide for users seeking in-depth information.

li.p: Comprehensive Information: Reference topics include detailed specifications, properties, options, and parameters, providing a thorough understanding of the subject matter.
Structured Information: They are often organized hierarchically or categorically to help users locate specific details efficiently and navigate complex information.
No Prescriptive Guidance: Reference topics do not include step-by-step instructions or procedures. Instead, they focus on presenting facts and details.
API Documentation: Reference topics are commonly used in API documentation to describe functions, classes, parameters, and their specifications.
Hardware Component Specifications: They are employed to provide detailed technical information about hardware components, including specifications and compatibility.
Software Feature Catalogs: Reference topics serve as catalogs of software features, configuration options, settings, and their detailed descriptions.
